title: Installation: caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7 vs. caffe2_cuda8.0_cudnn7
body_html:
Issue description

The website states that installing caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7 from the caffe2 channel should work in conda, however conda can't find the package. The version with underscores, caffe2_cuda8.0_cudnn7, instead, works. Is that intended or is that some bug/misconfiguration in the channel and/or my system?

Thanks in advance!

Code example

conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7

vs.

conda install -c caffe2 caffe2_cuda8.0_cudnn7

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): No
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version:
  • Python version: 2.7.15
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0 / 7
  • GPU models and configuration:
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):
  • CMake version:
  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

body:
## Issue description

The website states that installing caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7 from the caffe2 channel should work in conda, however conda can't find the package. The version with underscores, caffe2_cuda8.0_cudnn7, instead, works. Is that intended or is that some bug/misconfiguration in the channel and/or my system?

Thanks in advance!

## Code example

conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7

vs.

conda install -c caffe2 caffe2_cuda8.0_cudnn7


## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: Caffe2
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): No
- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version:
- Python version: 2.7.15
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0 / 7
- GPU models and configuration: 
- GCC version (if compiling from source):
- CMake version:
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
